name.ja: クリエイティブテクノロジーの分類

description: This taxonomy is a subjective grouping of various tools and concepts related to creative technology. This is the top level parent node for everything else.

name.ja: プログラム言語とフレームワーク

children.description: This is a collection of nodes related to the concept of Creative Code Frameworks, or areas of programming languages that are typically considered related to creative coding. Not all of these are strictly "Frameworks" but this umbrella term seems to suffice for now.
This is a category that organizes these frameworks
Visual programming environments using node-based interfaces for creative coding and real-time performance.
A visual development platform for creating real-time interactive multimedia content. Widely used for installations, VJing, and projection mapping with powerful GPU-accelerated processing.
A graphic programming environment for live performance, video art, and interactive media installations. Features real-time video processing and extensive hardware integration capabilities.
A browser-based visual programming tool for creating interactive 3D content and animations. Runs entirely in the browser using WebGL with real-time collaboration features.

A hybrid visual/textual live-programming environment for rapid prototyping and development. Designed for handling large media environments with physical interfaces, real-time motion graphics, and interactive installations.
A node-based visual programming language for real-time interactive media. Features live coding capabilities and efficient rendering for installations and performances.
A node-based software application for creating 2D visuals and animations using algorithmic design. Combines the power of programming with intuitive visual interfaces.
A browser-based visual programming environment for creating interactive experiences and generative art. Features WebGL support and real-time collaborative editing.
A visual programming language developed for creating interactive computer music and multimedia works. Open-source with extensive community support and real-time capabilities.
A visual programming language for music and multimedia developed by Cycling '74. Industry standard for interactive music, audio processing, and real-time performance systems.
A node-based authoring tool for real-time graphics and effects. Designed for live events, broadcast, and interactive installations with GPU-accelerated rendering.
High-performance C++ frameworks for creative coding offering direct hardware access and optimal performance for real-time applications.
An open-source C++ toolkit for creative coding with a focus on simplicity and ease of use. Provides a unified API for graphics, audio, video, and hardware interfacing.
A C++ library for programming graphics, audio, video, networking, image processing and computational geometry. Designed for professional-quality creative and computational projects.
A real-time engine built for creative applications including installations, performances, and audio-visual projects. Features high-performance rendering and extensive hardware integration.
Web-based JavaScript libraries and frameworks for creative coding that run in browsers with WebGL support.
A JavaScript library that makes coding accessible for artists, designers, educators, and beginners. Built on the philosophy of Processing with web-first approach.
A cross-browser JavaScript library for creating and displaying animated 3D computer graphics in web browsers using WebGL. Industry standard for web-based 3D content.
A vector graphics scripting framework that runs on top of HTML5 Canvas. Offers clean Scene Graph/DOM and extensive Path functionality for 2D graphics.
Modern JVM language frameworks for creative coding with strong type safety and concise syntax.
A Kotlin/JVM library for creative coding, real-time and interactive graphics applications and animations. Features modern APIs and comprehensive documentation.
Ruby-based creative coding frameworks emphasizing simplicity and expressiveness.
A Ruby library for creative coding and generative art. Provides intuitive APIs for drawing, animation, and interactive graphics with a focus on ease of use.
Memory-safe system programming language frameworks for high-performance creative applications.
A creative coding framework for Rust that aims to make it easy for artists to express themselves with simple, fast, reliable code. Focuses on graphics, audio, and interactive applications.
Python-based creative coding frameworks leveraging the language's simplicity and extensive ecosystem.
Python mode for Processing that combines the ease of Python with the power of the Processing graphics library. Ideal for teaching and rapid prototyping of visual ideas.
Java-based creative coding environments offering cross-platform compatibility and extensive library support.
A flexible software sketchbook and language for learning to code within the context of visual arts. The original Processing environment that inspired many other creative coding frameworks.
Low-level graphics APIs providing direct hardware access for maximum performance and control in creative applications.
Apple's low-level, low-overhead hardware-accelerated 3D graphics and compute API. Provides near-direct access to GPU for iOS, macOS, and tvOS applications.
Microsoft's collection of APIs for handling multimedia tasks, especially game programming and video on Windows platforms. Includes Direct3D for 3D graphics rendering.
Cross-platform graphics API for rendering 2D and 3D vector graphics. Industry standard for graphics programming across multiple platforms and programming languages.
JavaScript API for rendering interactive 2D and 3D graphics within web browsers without plugins. Based on OpenGL ES and enables GPU-accelerated graphics in web applications.
Low-overhead, cross-platform 3D graphics and compute API. Provides high-efficiency access to modern GPUs for applications requiring maximum performance and control.
Historical tools that shaped creative coding but are no longer actively developed or supported.
Adobe's multimedia software platform for creating vector graphics, animation, and interactive content. Widely used for web applications and games before being discontinued in 2020.
Multimedia authoring platform for creating interactive kiosks, CD-ROMs, and early web content. Pioneer in interactive multimedia development before Flash became dominant.
Apple's node-based visual programming language for processing and rendering graphical data. Used for motion graphics, visual effects, and interactive installations before being deprecated.
Different application areas and methodologies for creative coding frameworks.
Real-time programming as a performance practice where code is written and modified during live execution. Used in music, visuals, and interactive performances.
Connecting physical sensors and input devices to creative coding applications for responsive installations and interactive experiences.
Creating visual representations of data and information using creative coding techniques for analysis, communication, and artistic expression.
Large-scale installations using multiple displays or projection surfaces with synchronized content for immersive experiences and architectural integration.
Creating visual content through algorithmic processes and rule-based systems for art, animation, and dynamic graphics that evolve over time.

This category covers things like game engines and other 3D rendering concepts. While there may be considerable overlap with Creative Coding Frameworks, I think there is enough distinction in game engines that they can be captured in their own space.
Different categories of game engines and 3D frameworks organized by licensing and development model.
Free and open-source game engines and 3D frameworks with community-driven development and full source code access.
A powerful 3D engine based on WebGL, WebGPU and Web Audio for building web-based games and applications. Features extensive VR/AR support and advanced rendering capabilities.
A cross-browser JavaScript library for creating and displaying animated 3D computer graphics in web browsers using WebGL. Widely used for web-based 3D applications and creative projects.
A feature-packed, cross-platform game engine for creating 2D and 3D games. Uses its own scripting language (GDScript) and supports C# and C++ for high-performance needs.
Professional game engines with commercial licensing, offering comprehensive tools and enterprise support for large-scale development.
A comprehensive cross-platform game engine with visual editor and scripting in C#. Widely used for indie games, mobile apps, AR/VR experiences, and architectural visualization.
Epic Games' advanced game engine featuring high-end graphics, Blueprint visual scripting, and C++ programming. Industry standard for AAA games and real-time graphics applications.
Apple's 3D graphics framework for macOS, iOS, tvOS, and visionOS applications. Provides high-level APIs for rendering 3D scenes with easy integration into Apple's ecosystem.
A game engine developed by Crytek known for advanced graphics capabilities and large-scale environments. Features real-time global illumination and sophisticated physics systems.
Amazon's free cross-platform AAA game engine integrated with AWS cloud services and Twitch. Based on CryEngine with added cloud computing and streaming capabilities.
Virtual Reality technologies, devices, and concepts for creating immersive 3D experiences.
Head-mounted displays and VR hardware platforms for immersive virtual reality experiences.
PlayStation VR headset series designed for console gaming with PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5. Features inside-out tracking and exclusive VR game library.
High-end VR headset developed by HTC and Valve featuring room-scale tracking and precise motion controllers. Known for professional and enthusiast VR applications.
Premium VR headset by Valve with high refresh rate displays, finger-tracking controllers, and precise lighthouse tracking. Designed for high-fidelity VR experiences.
Meta's VR platform and ecosystem including Quest headsets and development tools for standalone and PC VR experiences.
Professional-grade mixed reality headset with advanced features like eye tracking, face tracking, and high-resolution displays. Designed for enterprise and professional use cases.
Latest consumer VR headset from Meta featuring mixed reality capabilities, improved performance, and color passthrough cameras for AR experiences.
Popular standalone VR headset offering wireless VR gaming and applications with optional PC connectivity. Known for accessibility and large content library.
Technical concepts and rendering techniques specific to VR and AR development.
A rendering technique that reduces computational load by rendering high detail only in the user's focal area. Critical for VR performance optimization and reducing motion sickness.
Augmented Reality and Mixed Reality technologies for blending digital content with the physical world.
Head-mounted displays and smart glasses designed for augmented and mixed reality applications.
Apple's spatial computing headset combining VR and AR capabilities with high-resolution displays and advanced hand tracking. Designed for productivity and immersive experiences.
Early smart glasses featuring a small display, camera, and voice control for hands-free computing. Primarily targeted at enterprise and industrial applications.
Mixed reality headset featuring spatial computing capabilities with digital light field technology. Designed for enterprise applications and spatial collaboration.
Microsoft's mixed reality headset designed for enterprise applications with advanced hand tracking, eye tracking, and spatial mapping capabilities.
Different technical approaches and frameworks for implementing augmented reality tracking and rendering.
AR tracking method using visual markers or targets that are recognized by computer vision algorithms to anchor digital content.
Computer vision platform for building AR applications with marker tracking, object recognition, and cloud-based target management. Widely used in mobile AR development.
SLAM technique combining camera data with inertial sensors to track device position and orientation for markerless AR experiences.
Apple's augmented reality framework for iOS devices providing motion tracking, environmental understanding, and light estimation for AR applications.
Simultaneous Localization and Mapping technology for real-time environment mapping and device tracking using various sensors.
Apple devices equipped with LiDAR sensors for enhanced depth sensing and improved AR tracking performance with instant plane detection.
Discontinued Google platform for augmented reality using specialized sensors for motion tracking, area learning, and depth perception on mobile devices.
Foundational concepts and paradigms in augmented and mixed reality development.
Computing paradigm where digital content exists and interacts within physical 3D space, enabling natural interaction with virtual objects in real environments.
Technology that merges real and virtual worlds to produce new environments where physical and digital objects co-exist and interact in real time.

Tools and technologies for web-based creative projects, including frontend frameworks, backend services, communication protocols, and networking technologies commonly used in interactive installations and digital art.
Client-side technologies and frameworks for creating interactive web experiences, user interfaces, and browser-based creative applications

A comprehensive framework for creating interactive music in the browser. Built on top of the Web Audio API, it provides high-level abstractions for synthesis, effects, and scheduling, making it ideal for creative audio applications and installations.
A combination of AR.js (augmented reality) and A-Frame (WebVR framework) that enables marker-based and markerless AR experiences directly in web browsers without requiring app downloads.

A commercial platform for building WebAR experiences with advanced features like surface detection, face tracking, and world tracking. Provides more robust AR capabilities than open-source alternatives.

A friendly machine learning library for creative coding built on top of TensorFlow.js. Makes machine learning accessible to artists and creative coders with simple APIs for image classification, pose detection, and more.
Hardware-accelerated graphics libraries and frameworks for high-performance 3D rendering, visual effects, and computational graphics in web browsers

A cross-browser JavaScript library that makes creating 3D graphics on the web accessible. Built on top of WebGL, it provides an easy-to-use API for 3D scenes, animations, and interactive experiences in web browsers.
A powerful, simple, and open 3D engine with native WebGPU support, real-time ray tracing, and comprehensive tools for web-based 3D applications
Next-generation graphics APIs and libraries leveraging WebGPU for advanced rendering and compute shaders
Safe and portable GPU abstraction in Rust, with WebGPU compatibility for high-performance graphics
Native implementation of WebGPU for desktop applications and performance-critical scenarios
Purpose-built libraries for specific graphics applications and creative coding
Functional WebGL programming with a declarative API designed for performance and simplicity
Minimal WebGL library focused on providing essential tools without abstraction overhead
2D WebGL renderer with fast performance for games and interactive graphics applications

A powerful JavaScript library for creating dynamic, interactive data visualizations using web standards. Provides low-level building blocks for binding data to DOM elements and applying data-driven transformations.
Popular JavaScript frameworks for building user interfaces and single-page applications
Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces with gentle learning curve
Comprehensive framework for building dynamic web applications with TypeScript
Component-based JavaScript library for building user interfaces with virtual DOM

A powerful vector graphics scripting framework that runs on top of the HTML5 Canvas. Offers a clean Scene Graph/Document Object Model and extensive functionality for creating complex graphics and animations.

A JavaScript library that makes coding accessible for artists, designers, educators, and beginners. Based on the core principles of Processing, it provides a full set of drawing functionality and creative coding tools for the web.
Native browser APIs that enable advanced creative functionalities without external libraries
APIs for accessing and manipulating media devices and content
Low-level audio processing and synthesis capabilities in the browser
Access to connected media input devices like cameras and microphones
Access to MIDI devices for musical instrument control and interaction
Access to device sensors for motion-based and environmental interactions
Access to device acceleration and rotation data for motion-based interactions
Access to device location for location-based creative applications
APIs for precise timing, measurement, and optimization of web applications
Synchronized animation loop with the browser's refresh rate for smooth animations
Background threads for heavy computations without blocking the main UI thread
Server-side technologies, databases, and infrastructure for supporting web-based creative applications and installations
Ways of communicating between two devices or computers

A communication protocol that provides full-duplex communication channels over a single TCP connection. Enables real-time, bidirectional communication between web browsers and servers, commonly used in interactive installations.

A protocol for communication among computers, sound synthesizers, and other multimedia devices optimized for modern networking technology. Widely used in interactive installations and live performance systems for real-time control.

A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine that allows JavaScript to run on servers. Enables full-stack JavaScript development and is commonly used for real-time applications, APIs, and creative project backends.
Serverless computing and edge technologies for scalable, low-latency creative applications
Function-as-a-Service platforms for event-driven backend logic
Serverless functions optimized for frontend frameworks and edge deployment
AWS Lambda-powered serverless functions integrated with Netlify hosting
JavaScript runtime at the edge for ultra-low latency applications
TypeScript edge functions with built-in database and auth integration
Managed services for real-time communication and data synchronization
Hosted WebSocket service for real-time features in web and mobile apps
Real-time messaging platform with global edge network for low-latency communication
Real-time bidirectional event-based communication library
Data formats and protocols for exchanging information between systems and applications
Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral serialization mechanism for structured data
Human-readable data serialization standard commonly used for configuration files
JavaScript Object Notation - a lightweight, text-based data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write. Widely used for data transmission between servers and web applications.
Extensible markup language for structured data representation and document exchange

Different methods and categories of sensing people and allowing interactions with digital interfaces and experiences. This is heavily related to the optical tracking and Physical computing categories as well.
Tools and concepts related to optical tracking elements that may appear in various creative technology and experiential projects. See also the topic of Cameras in the Sensor/Interaction method group
Various camera technologies used for computer vision, motion capture, and interactive installations in creative projects
Different categories of cameras suitable for various creative technology applications
Video cameras for real-time capture and streaming in interactive installations and live performances
Compact, rugged cameras for capturing movement and action in extreme environments
Popular action camera series with high-quality video capture and rugged design
Built-in cameras in mobile devices, increasingly powerful for computer vision applications
High-end video cameras for professional video production and broadcast quality capture
Television and live streaming cameras with high-end optics and real-time output
Surveillance cameras that can be repurposed for creative installations and monitoring
Computer-connected cameras for video conferencing and basic computer vision applications
Cameras capable of extremely high frame rates for slow motion analysis and artistic effects
Network-connected cameras that transmit video data over IP networks for remote access
Cameras that capture infrared light for depth sensing, thermal imaging, and night vision
Standard infrared cameras for basic IR imaging and night vision applications
Cameras that measure distance to objects using infrared structured light or time-of-flight
Intel's depth sensing cameras using structured light and stereo vision technology
Microsoft's depth sensing camera originally for Xbox, popular in creative coding
3D depth sensing cameras with structured light technology for computer vision
Industrial 3D cameras using stereo vision for precise depth measurement
Cameras that detect thermal radiation for temperature mapping and heat-based interaction
Leading manufacturer of thermal imaging cameras for various applications
Digital Single Lens Reflex cameras with interchangeable lenses and manual controls
Compact interchangeable lens cameras without the mirror mechanism of DSLRs
Dual camera systems that capture depth information using stereo vision principles
High-performance stereo camera with AI-powered depth sensing and tracking
Algorithms and techniques for analyzing and understanding visual information from cameras and images
Advanced computer vision techniques using artificial intelligence and machine learning
Recognition and interpretation of hand and body gestures for natural user interfaces
Technology that detects and follows eye movements for interaction and attention analysis
Professional eye tracking devices for research and interactive applications
Full body pose estimation and tracking for motion analysis and interactive installations
Open source computer vision library with comprehensive tools for image processing
Fundamental computer vision algorithms and methods for image analysis
Finding and tracing the boundaries of objects in images
Tracking motion of objects between consecutive frames in video sequences
Detecting and following connected regions of similar pixels in images
Isolating moving objects by removing the static background from video frames
Detecting motion by comparing consecutive frames to find pixel changes
Advanced tracking technologies and specialized systems for professional motion capture and virtual production
Ultra-low latency tracking systems for real-time applications and responsive interactions
Extended reality and virtual production technologies combining physical and digital environments
Professional motion capture systems for character animation and performance capture
Optical motion capture systems using multiple cameras to track markers or markerless movement
Camera tracking systems for virtual production and broadcast environments
Camera tracking technology for film and virtual production workflows
Professional optical motion capture systems used in film, games, and research
Inertial measurement unit systems using accelerometers and gyroscopes for wireless motion tracking
Affordable motion capture suits using IMU sensors for indie creators
Professional inertial motion capture systems for entertainment and biomechanics
Additional professional tracking technologies for specialized applications
Precision optical tracking systems for motion capture, VR, and robotics applications
Real-time tracking system for live entertainment and interactive installations
Touch-based interaction technologies including hand tracking, pressure sensing, and multi-touch interfaces for creative applications
Hand tracking sensor that detects finger and hand movements for gesture-based interaction
Pressure-sensitive touchpad technology for precise force and multi-touch detection
Touch sensing technology that detects changes in electrical capacitance from finger contact
Interactive display surfaces that respond to touch input for direct manipulation interfaces
Advanced capacitive touch technology supporting multi-touch and gesture recognition
Large-format multi-touch tables and displays for interactive installations
Infrared touch technology using light beams to detect finger interruption
Optical touch technology that detects shadows cast by objects on the screen surface
Light detection and ranging technology for large-scale interactive surfaces and LED walls
Professional LIDAR sensors for accurate 3D mapping and distance measurement
High-performance digital LIDAR sensors for mapping and autonomous systems
Bluetooth-based proximity and location sensing technologies for interactive experiences and IoT applications
Small wireless transmitters that broadcast signals for proximity-based interactions and location services
Technologies for detecting position, movement, and spatial relationships in physical environments for interactive installations
Additional sensing technologies including biometric sensors, environmental sensors, and specialized input devices for creative applications
Tools and concepts related to physical computing elements that may appear in various creative technology and experiential projects.
Tools related to display technology, cameras, media servers, related software and other concepts
Product from Light Field Labs, not yet released in early 2025
Product that uses hundreds of individual projectors to make an actual light field above the display
Company may be out of commission as of 2025, but previous had several flexible display kits
Layers of transparent screens
Strands of LED pixels arranged in a physical volume
Various approaches to autostereoscopic displays, both spatial and temporal multiplexing
Lenticular autostereoscopic displays from small to large
Not technically auto-stereoscopic, but seems like it could fall into this category. A tilable high resolution LED wall that uses passive polarized glasses to create a 3D image from a large LED wall
Temporally multiplexed image
Laser projection as a unique visual approach
Displays that are unusual shapes or circular
Thermochromic paint, glow in the dark, etc
Uses various mechanical methods to display images

name.en: See sensor category for more cameras

children.description: This was primarily meant for professional cameras. See sensor category for more cameras.
Some Media servers have dedicated hardware and some are hybrids that have a software component and dedicated hardware platform. This category captures ones that have dedicated hardware
Formerly known as d3
Software for performing live visuals
Cloud-based projection planning tool

name.en: Media Servers or Large Scale Tools

children.description: Formerly known as d3

A large category that outlines concepts and tools related to professional grade (and some consumer grade) audiovisual hardware and software. Typically things used in large productions, stage shows, and installations
See Display Tech and Video Category

Artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, frameworks, and applications for creative technology projects. Includes generative AI, computer vision, natural language processing, and specialized AI tools.
AI systems for analyzing, classifying, and understanding content across different media types including text, images, audio, and video
Computer vision techniques for detecting, classifying, and tracking objects in images and video
Real-time human pose estimation in the browser using TensorFlow.js
Google's framework for building multimodal applied ML pipelines
Open source computer vision and machine learning software library
You Only Look Once - real-time object detection system with multiple versions
AI-powered video generation and animation tools for creating dynamic visual content
AI models that generate videos from text descriptions
Google's latest video generation model with improved quality and control
OpenAI's advanced video generation model capable of creating realistic scenes
Runway's latest generation video model with enhanced motion and consistency
AI video generation platform focused on accessibility and ease of use
Open-source video generation model from Stability AI
AI tools that animate static images into video content
Animate images using diffusion models with temporal consistency
Convert 2D images into immersive depth animations
AI-powered tools for editing and enhancing existing video content
Comprehensive AI video editing and generation platform
AI-powered video upscaling and enhancement software
GUI Wrappers and Utilities for various AI Image creation tools
See also: Photogrammetry
Neural Radiance Fields
AI systems that can process and generate multiple types of content including text, images, audio, and video
AI models that understand and generate both visual and textual content
Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training for zero-shot image classification
Advanced text-to-image generation with improved prompt following
GPT-4 with vision capabilities for image understanding and analysis
Large Language and Vision Assistant for multimodal conversations
AI systems that process and generate speech, music, and sound with language understanding
Robust speech recognition system with multilingual capabilities
Text-to-music generation model for creating musical compositions
Suite of models for audio generation including music and sound effects
AI systems designed for real-time multimodal interaction and processing
Real-time voice and vision capabilities in GPT-4o
Claude's ability to interact with computer interfaces in real-time
Autonomous AI systems that can plan, reason, and execute complex tasks with minimal human intervention
AI agents designed for natural conversation and task assistance
Framework for building custom AI assistants with specific capabilities
Platform for creating and interacting with AI characters
AI companion focused on emotional support and personal conversation
AI agents that automate workflows and complete specific tasks autonomously
Autonomous GPT-based agent for complex task completion
Framework for building agents with reasoning and tool usage capabilities
AI-powered automation for connecting and automating apps
Specialized agents for creative tasks like design, writing, and content creation
AI-powered creative tools integrated into Adobe's creative suite
AI design assistant for creating graphics and visual content
AI writing and productivity assistant integrated into Notion workspace
Frameworks, platforms, and development environments for building AI and machine learning applications
Core frameworks for building and training machine learning models
Dynamic neural network framework with strong research community support
Open-source machine learning platform with comprehensive ecosystem
Composable transformations of Python+NumPy programs for high-performance ML
State-of-the-art pre-trained models for natural language processing
Interactive environments for AI experimentation and development
Interactive computational environment for data science and AI research
Cloud-based Jupyter notebook environment with free GPU access
Data science platform with notebooks and datasets for ML competitions
No-code and low-code platforms for creative AI applications
Creative toolkit powered by machine learning for artists and creators
Google's tool for training custom machine learning models without coding
Visual tool for building machine learning models without code
Advanced language models capable of text generation, code completion, reasoning, and multimodal tasks for creative applications
Models specialized for text creation, creative writing, and content generation
OpenAI's series of generative pre-trained transformer models
Conversational AI based on GPT models for interactive text generation
OpenAI's multimodal model with enhanced reasoning and creativity
AI assistant focused on helpful, harmless, and honest interactions
Advanced model with strong reasoning and creative capabilities
Google's multimodal AI model family with text and reasoning capabilities
Open-source language models from Meta with strong performance
AI models specialized for programming, code completion, and software development
AI pair programmer that suggests code completions and functions
Code generation model that powers GitHub Copilot
Code understanding and generation model from Google
Claude's specialized capabilities for programming and code analysis
Community-driven and open-source language models for local deployment
Open-source models with strong performance and efficiency
Tool for running language models locally on personal computers
Community-fine-tuned models based on LLaMA for instruction following
Various concepts and technologies related to mobile devices in the context of creative technology projects.
Tools related to making assets (like images, videos, etc) that might be used by other concepts in this list.
Tools related to making digital creations in the physical realm, from 2D Printers to 3D Printers...
aka Receipt Printers
Various topics that are still tangentially related to working with technology at various professional scales, particularly technology utilites and tools related to Dev Ops (or Developer Operations)
